subject: RE: [junit] Experience with jdk1.4 assert keyword
msgSnippet: ... Are you saying you prefer to use the assert or the IllegalArgumentException in this case ? In the example I would prefer the Exception, to enforce my
messageBody:
>But they are a great way to
>communicate your intentions (example: asserting that the integer parameter
>of a method is greater than 0 communicates to the reader of the code your
>assumptions about the way that the method should be used). IMHO, that's the
>most important reason to use asserts.

Are you saying you prefer to use the assert or the IllegalArgumentException
in this case ?
In the example I would prefer the Exception, to enforce my preconditions.
Asserts allow the method to be executed with a negative parameter, maybe
resulting in some fictitious value being returned without detection.

I see more relevance in asserting assumptions being made about the internal
state of an object, (but then you are probably not writing unit tests, if
you need to do that...).

Using JUnit, I do not yet see the usefulness/necessity of the assert
statement. Maybe I'm just missing something ?
